Text.val: Create data, if none exists
Delete the temp list, if it exists. We only do this once, so we can keep the user's choice
if they decide to print the same report multiple times.

ExpSyntax.val: 'RP02_ How Do I Dump the Current View to a File?'

Text.val: Get list of variables in the parent task.
Loop through the vector list, selecting which ones to print
Create a table entry, if this variable doesn't start with a lower-case 'v'
The convention here is that variables starting with 'v' do not belong on reports, they are
internal variables for the program.
Now that the user has chosen which variables to export, create a string to send to the function
Un-comment these (Ctrl+Shift+D) for debugging, to see how the strings look (or use the Debugger)
Create the export file based on the format type
The function did not work. Give error.
For some reason, there was no data. Give error.
File was created: display it
Update file name variable, if the user chose anything.
If the Format was changed, re-display the filename
Store the data in the parent task, to use as defaults for next time
(Alternatively, we could have used passed parameters)

Text.valUnicode: {\rtf1\ansi\ansicpg1252\deff0\deflang1033{\fonttbl{\f0\fswiss\fprq2\fcharset0 Microsoft Sans Serif;}{\f1\fnil\fcharset0 Microsoft Sans Serif;}} {\colortbl ;\red0\green128\blue255;\red0\green0\blue0;} {\*\generator Msftedit 5.41.15.1515;}\viewkind4\uc1\pard\cf1\b\i\f0\fs20 How to export your Address Book:\cf2\i0\f1\par \par 1. Select the fields you want to export on the table to the left. By default all fields are selected. \par \par 2. Change the output order, if desired, by re-numbering the Order field.\par \par 3. Type in a new Display name, if desired.\par \par 4. Select the desired output format. "txt" format can use any delimiter, but will default to a comma.\par \par 5. Change the output file name, if desired. You may Zoom or press the ... button to choose an existing file. If the file exists, it will be overwritten.\par \par 6. Press OK. The data will be exported, and the resulting file will be displayed. This is done using the current Windows default settings.\par }

Text.val: Create each entry for the list for the user.
Note that we don't recreate the list here: if the user has already changed the sort order, it will still be selected.
Cycle through the variables chosen by the user, to create the list of variables
Send back the results, minus the last comma
